headline: Kroger’s $24.6 Billion Albertsons Deal Blocked by Judge
summary: (Bloomberg) -- A judge blocked Kroger Co.’s $24.6 billion acquisition of Albertsons Cos., finding the takeover would lessen competition for US grocery shoppers, in a ruling that marks a likely death knell for the deal. headline: Kroger’s Deal for Grocer Rival Albertsons Blocked by Judge
summary: A federal-district court judge in Oregon has issued a preliminary injunction blocking  Kroger  planned acquisition of Alberstons, in a deal valued at more than $24 billion.  The suit was brought by the Federal Trade Commission, eight states, and the District of Columbia.  Kroger initially announced the merger deal in October 2022, with a plan to acquire all shares outstanding of Albertson’s for around $34 each.

headline: Kroger-Albertsons Merger Blocked by Court, Handing Victory to Biden Antitrust Enforcers
summary: The ruling hands a victory to Biden antitrust enforcers, who said the $20 billion supermarket merger would erode competition and raise prices for consumers.

headline: FTC wins big as judge blocks Kroger-Albertsons merger
summary: In a major victory for the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and the Biden Administration, a federal judge has temporarily blocked the $25 billion merger between grocery giants Kroger (KR) and Albertsons (ACI), citing concerns over the impact on competition.

summary: Shares of grocer Kroger finished Tuesday higher, rising in afternoon trading on the news that a court blocked its planned merger with Albertsons.

headline: Kroger Jumps As Judge Blocks Biggest Grocery Merger In History
summary: A district judge ruled Kroger's $24.6 billion takeover of Albertsons would reduce competition for U.S. grocery shoppers, likely squelching the deal.

raw.headline: Kroger Jumps As Judge Blocks Biggest Grocery Merger In History
raw.summary: A district judge ruled Kroger's $24.6 billion takeover of Albertsons would reduce competition for U.S. grocery shoppers, likely squelching the deal.

headline: Kroger-Albertsons deal blocked by federal judge
summary: A federal judge sided with the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) in its bid to halt a merger between grocery store giants Kroger (KR) and Albertsons (ACI). The companies had agreed to sell some of their stores to C&S Wholesale to help alleviate some of the FTC's concerns, but US District Judge Adrienne Nelson writes "There is ample evidence that the divestiture is not sufficient in scale to adequately compete with the merged firm and is structured in a way that will significantly disadvantage C&S as a competitor." Market Domination Anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton report on the breaking news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Stephanie Mikulich.

headline: Federal judge blocks Kroger's $25B acquisition of Albertsons
summary: A federal judge issued a ruling that blocks the proposed $25 billion merger between Albertsons and Kroger, which critics argued would reduce competition in the grocery industry.

headline: US court blocks Kroger's $25-billion acquisition of grocery rival Albertsons
summary: (Reuters) -A U.S. judge blocked the pending $25-billion merger of U.S. grocery chains Kroger and Albertsons on Tuesday, a win for the Federal Trade Commission that Kroger has said would likely scuttle the deal.  The FTC argued at a three-week trial in Portland, Oregon, that the merger would eliminate head-to-head competition between the top two traditional grocery chains, leading to higher prices for shoppers and reduced bargaining leverage for unionized workers.  Americans' discontent over a lingering rise in grocery prices since the pandemic was a key theme in the run-up to President-elect Donald Trump's win in November.

headline: Home Chef Forecasts Six Home Cooking Trends for 2025
summary: As year's end approaches, Home Chef – the number one meal delivery service* – reflects on another year of delivering simple, delicious meals to households nationwide. Home Chef customers took their kitchen clout to new levels this past year – from expanding palates and diving deep into flavor fads to an increased interest in better-for-you, convenient choices. headline: Kroger Named to Computerworld 2025 List of Best Places to Work in IT
summary: The Kroger Co. (NYSE: KR), today announced it has been named to Foundry's Computerworld 2025 Best Places to Work in IT. This year's recognition marks the seventh consecutive year Kroger's associates have been recognized by Computerworld for their innovative and industry-leading workplace culture. Kroger ranks No. 50 among large organizations on the Best Places to Work in IT list.
